payload.name: qualitative
payload.core: Reason with qualitative states (increasing, decreasing, positive/negative influence) instead of exact numbers. Use sign algebra and monotone constraints for directional predictions when quantitative data is unavailable.
proc: Identify variables of interest and their qualitative states (+, -, 0, ?)
Map influence relations: does X increasing cause Y to increase (+) or decrease (-)?
Propagate signs through influence graph using sign algebra
Check for ambiguous paths where influences conflict
Validate directional predictions against known constraints
Flag regions where nonlinear thresholds may invalidate sign reasoning
check: All variables have defined qualitative states
Influence signs are justified by domain knowledge
Conflicting paths explicitly noted as ambiguous
Predictions stated as directional claims, not magnitudes

diff.fermi: Fermi gives rough numeric estimates; Qualitative reasons about directions without numbers
diff.systems-thinking: Systems adds loop closure, delays, and stocks; Qualitative is simpler sign propagation
diff.causal-inference: Causal inference quantifies effects rigorously; Qualitative captures direction only

fail.mode: Missing nonlinear thresholds where sign reasoning breaks down
fail.signal: Prediction fails outside narrow range; 'more X means more Y' only true conditionally
mit: Explicitly state range where monotonicity holds
Use Fermi estimates to bound the valid regime

use: Feedback reasoning: does this influence make sense?
Trend sanity checks before quantitative modeling

rel.name: fermi
rel.note: use Fermi for rough numeric estimates

rel.name: systems-thinking
rel.note: upgrade to systems when loops and delays matter

rel.name: causal-inference
rel.note: upgrade when rigorous causal effects needed

ex.problem: Will adding a cache improve latency?
ex.caveat: Only holds until cache exceeds working set; beyond that, hit_rate saturates
